title: Graduate Quantitative Developer
description:
- Direct applications from locally based candidates only (no agencies) -


Who we are

WEBB Traders is a fast-growing, global proprietary trading company driven by data and technology. We act as a market maker using our own capital to trade on global stock and derivatives exchanges. By leveraging a large network of interdealer brokers and the latest advancements in electronic trading technology, we add liquidity to the financial markets, specialized in cash equity and derivatives. With our 70 employees of over 25 different nationalities, we are united in our great ambition to grow WEBB into a global leader in arbitrage and liquidity.

Since our very first trade in 2009, WEBB’s headquarters have been based in Amsterdam. With a focus on derivative trading, the Paris team of 15 highly skilled traders, researchers, and engineers plays a crucial role in discovering untapped market opportunities.

Join us to accelerate your career in the unique trading culture of openness, community, enjoyment, and boundary-free entrepreneurship.

Come and kick-start your IT career at a growing, high-performance trading scale-up.


WEBB Traders is looking for graduate software engineers to join our R&D team in Amsterdam or Paris. The R&D team is responsible for the evolution of our trading solutions, tools, data processing, workflow automation and connectivity. We are continuously improving our systems and processes, and since we are a small company, we are looking for engineers who are interested in gaining responsibility very quickly and have a significant impact on the short- and long-term future of WEBB Traders as a whole.

During the first few years of your career at WEBB Traders, you will have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of projects, as you rotate through all the different areas of our business. You will learn how to devise and optimise trading algorithms, implement (data) control processes, build crucial infrastructural components and work with big data. We will share with you our secrets to designing and building effective, high-quality software and creating a high-performance environment with a consistently high rate of innovation and true agility.

You will be

  • Learning about the trading domain through training sessions and on-the-job interactions

  • Developing and optimising software solutions for trading and all supporting processes, using C++, C#, Python, Rust and (postgre)SQL

  • Deeply understanding and improving the numerous processes across the company

  • Collaborating with your team to devise the most effective solutions

  • Interacting with users to understand their objectives and improve their work through your technical ingenuity


Who are you

  • Eager, curious, and a fast learner

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science

  • Strong computer science fundamentals

  • Understanding of computer architecture, networking, and databases

  • Hands-on experience with modern C++, design patterns & idioms

  • 0 to 2 years of experience in a software engineering role

  • Team player who thrives in an agile and fast-paced environment

  • Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills with a ‘get it done mentality

Your future work environment


Challenge yourself. Be part of the dynamic work environment and grow along with us.

Develop yourself. Join internal and external training sessions covering trading software, agile methodologies, and hardware and software management

Treat yourself. Enjoy delicious meals with your personal Swile card

Stay fit. Sports facility access via Gymlib

Keep the spirit up. Fun activities with your teammates on a regular basis

Team up. A great office vibe in the heart of Paris, right between the 8th and 9th arrondissement

It’s on us. Benefit from a health insurance plan that's 100% paid by us, as well as contingency cover (life insurance, disability pension, etc.)

And finally… A competitive reward package including a bonus scheme


Application process

1. Apply on our WEBBsite in English!
2. Share a short motivation for joining WEBB and why you think you are a great fit for this role
3. Have a video chat with us (unless you are around, you may drop by for a coffee)
4. Nail the programming challenge to show your engineering superpowers
5. Visit our Paris office for the interviews and a drink
6. Accept our offer!

title: Software Engineer (Python,DevOps,Flask et FastAPI,SQL et NoSQL,IA) -(h/f)
description:
Le rôle principal de cet Ingénieur Logiciel repose sur la conception, le développement et le déploiement de solutions logicielles dans le domaine de l'IA et de la GenAI, apportant ainsi des innovations grâce à l'utilisation de Python et des pratiques DevOps.

title: Software Engineer - HIL and Simulation
description:
At Dark, we passionately believe that space represents not only a cornerstone of the modern world but also a catalyst for shaping our future. Our mission is clear: pioneering spacecraft and mission designs for the protection of vital orbits and assets.

That is why we are gathering a team of bright minds to tackle crucial challenges through advanced engineering. Our focus? Velocity. We are kicking in technologies that will enable faster-than-ever orbital missions, ushering in a new era defined by unprecedented agility and boundless opportunity.

Joining the software department, you will participate in the development of Dark's Software-In-The-Loop and Hardware-In-The-Loop capabilities. You will be responsible for the development of new simulator features, interfacing with the GNC team to gather adequate models and with the avionics team for the design of the interface with the operational boards.

Learn more about our mission: mission manifesto.

First Missions

  • Getting up to speed with the simulator architecture and past development activities
  • Implementing an absolute attitude sensor emulation capacity
  • Interfacing through ROS with the Matlab/Simulink model for the flight dynamics extrapolation

Responsibilities

  • Providing emulated capacities to enable complete testing of the software and electronic boards
  • Developing ROS-based packages to emulate sensors/actuators interfaces
  • Defining requirements and coordinating the development of electronic boards to interface spacecraft components
  • Implementing Hardware-In-the-Loop tests of Avionics components
  • Integrating Simulink plant model blocks into a C++ framework
  • Interfacing with and supporting GNC and electronics teams
  • Contributing to the software processes and tools, to meet high-quality engineering standards
  • Identifying commonalities with the Ground Segment software suite

Requirements

  • 7+ years of experience in software development (experience in V&V processes is a plus)
  • Ideal background from the Defense / Aerospace industry (e.g. MBDA, Thales, Dassault, Safran, etc.)
  • Theorical and applied skills in C++ and Python programming languages
  • Knowledge of ROS
  • Hands-on experience with real-time applications
  • Basic understanding of electronics and low-layer software
  • Basic understanding of GNC and spacecraft flight dynamics
  • As we have an international team, knowledge of technical English is required. Fluency in French is a plus

Culture

We recognize that extraordinary work ethics turn mere achievements into triumphs. Hence, we hold each team member accountable for enhancing collaborative performance within Dark by embodying the following skillset:

  • Methodology – Your ability to clearly define and articulate the steps required to achieve a desired outcome
  • Relevancy – Your capacity to discern and select the most appropriate course of action based on the prevailing context and circumstances
  • Results – Consistently obtaining and updating the necessary resources and information to drive towards the intended outcome effectively

Learn more about our culture: culture manifesto.

Benefits

  • Join - our core team, poised to expand into a company with hundreds.
  • Engage - in a deeply technical project with high level systems trade-off and long term industrial vision.
  • Learn - every day in an environment driven by continuous improvement.
  • Enjoy - a team rewarding autonomy and uphold high standard at work.

Salary package ranging from 62 K€ to 80 K€ gross, additional performance bonuses and project-based bonuses.

title: Developpeur.se Back-end
description:
À propos de DQE

DQE Software est un éditeur spécialisé dans la qualité des données clients.
Nous aidons les entreprises à fiabiliser, dédupliquer et enrichir leurs données de contact en temps réel ou en back-office. Nos solutions innovantes — DQE DataQ et DQE Unify — sont utilisées par plus de 800 entreprises dont les plus grands groupes présents du CAC 40. Notre mission améliorer l’ expérience client ainsi que la performance business.

Avec une croissance annuelle de 25 % et un objectif de 20 M€ de chiffre d’affaires d’ici 2026, DQE est un acteur clé de la transformation digitale en France et à l’international.

À propos du poste

Dans une optique de maintenir nos produits historiques, assurer la continuité et migrer vers des architectures plus modernes, notre équipe R&D Core a besoin de renforcer sa maîtrise de la stack C/C++ et Python.

Ce poste, c’est donc à la fois de la stabilité technique et de la projection vers demain.

En tant que Software Engineer, vous interviendrez sur :

  • Le développement et la maintenance des applications cœur de métier (C/C++, Python)
  • La migration technique des produits vers une nouvelle architecture
  • L’écriture de tests unitaires et leur intégration dans une chaîne CI/CD
  • Le debug et la correction de bugs critiques
  • Le partage de connaissances avec l’équipe, dans une logique de backup technique

Compétences recherchées

  • Maîtrise de C/C++ – 5 ans d’expérience minimum
  • Bon niveau en Python 2/3
  • Très bonne connaissance de Git et GitLab
  • Expérience en Linux, et à l’aise également sous Windows
  • Maîtrise des tests unitaires, intégration continue
  • Bonne capacité d’analyse, de priorisation et de debug
  • Bon niveau d’anglais écrit
  • Un esprit pragmatique, qui aime optimiser et recherche l'efficience

Processus de recrutement

1 - Vous serez contacté par notre RH pour un premier échange
2 - Vous rencontrerez Gérôme, manager de l’équipe Core, pour faire un point plus détaillé sur vos compétences techniques
3 - Un test technique sera prévu avec deux personnes de l’équipe
4 - Vous rencontrerez François, notre CTO, ainsi qu’un autre manager de l’équipe R&D.

Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?

  • Un produit central au cœur du métier de DQE, avec un impact direct sur tous les clients
  • Une équipe technique bienveillante et soudée, où chaque voix compte
  • De la liberté technique, tant qu’elle reste alignée avec les objectifs de l’équipe
  • De vraies opportunités d’évolution au sein de la R&D ou vers des rôles transverses

title: Senior ML Ops Engineer (x/f/m)
description:
What you'll do


At Doctolib, we're on a mission to transform the way healthcare is delivered by leveraging the power of AI.

We are seeking a highly skilled, motivated, and collaborative Senior MLOps Engineer to join our ML Platform Team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in developing, deploying, and maintaining machine learning models and systems, ensuring their performance and scalability. You will collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, platform engineers and other stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions that power Doctolib products for care teams and patients.


Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:


  • Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to develop and deploy machine learning models, ensuring they meet performance, scalability, and reliability requirements.
  • Implement and maintain the MLOps pipeline, including version control, continuous integration, continuous deployment, and monitoring of machine learning models.
  • Develop tools, frameworks, and best practices to streamline the model development and deployment process.
  • Ensure the availability, reliability, and performance of machine learning models and systems, proactively addressing any issues that arise.
  • Monitor the performance of machine learning models in production, identifying areas for improvement and working with data scientists to optimize the models.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in MLOps and machine learning technologies, incorporating them into the ML Platform Team's workflows as appropriate.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, provide technical guidance, and contribute to the development of machine learning solutions.
  • Document MLOps processes, standards, and best practices to ensure knowledge transfer and consistency across the team
  • Share & advocate your work with the tech community

Our stack


  • Programming languages : Python / Pyspark / SQL.
  • Cloud providers : AWS / Azure.
  • Machine Learning platform : AWS SageMaker
  • Container / Orchestration : AWS ECS / Docker
  • Data warehouse / storage : AWS S3 / AWS Redshift
  • Databases : PostgreSQL
  • Search engine : ElasticSearch
  • Data capture tool : AWS Kinesis
  • ML pipeline : AWS Step Functions / AWS Lambda / AWS SageMaker.
  • Infrastructure as code : Terraform

And any other tool you deem relevant!


Who you are


If you don't meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply!

You could be our next team mate if you:


  • Have a good team spirit, enjoy learning new skills and have a strong sense of initiative
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work well in cross-functional teams and write clear documentation.
  • Have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; advanced degree preferred
  • Idealy a first experience in MLOps Engineer, Cloud engineer for Machine Learning applications or similar role.
  • Are proficient in our core languages : Python / SQL / Shell Scripting / Terraform
  • Good understanding of machine learning algorithms / concepts / trends
  • First experience in Deep Learning Framework, preferably PyTorch
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms like AWS and services like Amazon SageMaker, EC2, ECS, S3, CloudWatch and/or Azure and GCP equivalents.
  • Interest in building with HuggingFace Technologies, including Transformers, Diffusers, Accelerate, PEFT
  • Have experience in building MLOps pipelines for containerizing models and solutions with Docker


Now, it would be fantastic if you:

  • Have experience with Kubernetes, GitOps tools (e.g. ArgoCD) and/or Kafka
  • Have experience with Terraform Enterprise / Hashicorp Vault / Cloudflare is a plus
  • Have experience developing in Javascript / Typescript and using deployment in the browser (transformers.js / langchain.js)
  • Have experience with ML model quantization and optimization

What we offer


  • Free health insurance for you and your children
  • Parent Care Program: receive one additional month of leave on top of the legal parental leave
  • Free mental health and coaching services through our partner Moka.care
  • For caregivers and workers with disabilities, a package including an adaptation of the remote policy, extra days off for medical reasons, and psychological support
  • Work from EU countries and the UK for up to 10 days per year, thanks to our flexibility days policy
  • Work Council subsidy to refund part of sport club membership or creative class
  • Up to 14 days of RTT
  • A subsidy from the work council to refund part of the membership to a sport club or a creative class
  • Lunch voucher with Swile card

The interview process


  • HR interview by phone (45 minutes)
  • Hiring manager interview (1 hour)
  • Case study & case restitution (1 hour)
  • Behavioral interview / Meet the team session (1 hour / half day immersion)
  • At least one reference check
  • A copy of your criminal records ("extrait de casier judiciaire B3")

Job details


  • Permanent position
  • Full Time
  • Workplace : Paris area
  • Start date: asap
  • Remuneration : fix + bonus on objectives (according to your profile)

At Doctolib, we believe in improving access to healthcare for everyone - regardless of where you come from, what you look like. This translates into our recruitment process: Doctolib is an equal opportunity employer. We don't just accept diversity at Doctolib, we respect and celebrate it!


The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or place of origin. If you have a disability, let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process smoother for you!


All the information transmitted via this form is processed by Doctolib for the purpose of managing applications. For more information on how Doctolib processes your application data, click here.


If you wish to exercise your rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data, you can write to us at hr.dataprivacy(at)doctolib.com.

title: Software Engineer
description:
About The Flex:

The Flex is on a mission to transform the rental sector globally. We believe that renting a home should be as easy as buying an item from Amazon. Giving tenants the option to easily rent anywhere in the world and giving landlords simple, hassle-free property management without excessive management fees. We are building a small and dynamic team of A-Players, who are committed to growth and ready to scale The Flex to a global powerhouse in its sector. We believe in rewarding ambition and promoting from within.

Position Summary

As a Software Developer, you will be instrumental in designing, developing, and maintaining robust digital solutions to support The Flex operations and customer experiences. You will work on a variety of projects spanning front-end and back-end development, cloud deployment, and automation. This role requires strong problem-solving skills, adaptability, and a proactive approach to driving innovation and efficiency in our software systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Full-Stack Development: Design, develop, and maintain scalable web applications using Node.js and React.

  • Deployment & Cloud Management: Deploy and manage applications on AWS Cloud, utilizing serverless architecture.

  • API Development: Design, implement, and optimize RESTful APIs using FastAPI (Python optional) and other modern frameworks.

  • Automation & Scripting: Build automation tools to streamline development processes.

  • Problem-Solving & Debugging: Analyze complex problems, identify root causes, and implement efficient solutions.

  • Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and execution of key projects.

  • Code Quality & Best Practices: Implement CI/CD pipelines, conduct code reviews, and ensure best practices in Git, testing, and software quality assurance.

What We’re Looking For:

  • Proficiency in Node.js, React, and AWS Cloud.

  • Experience with serverless applications and cloud infrastructure.

  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to quickly learn new technologies.

  • Familiarity with FastAPI, Python, and scripting is a plus.

  • Understanding of modern software development practices (CI/CD, testing, Git).

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

  • Adaptability and a proactive, solution-oriented mindset.

Why Join The Flex?

  • Be part of an innovative and fast-growing company revolutionizing the real estate industry.

  • Opportunity to build a team and establish a long-term presence in one of Europe’s most vibrant cities.

  • Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.

  • A chance to grow professionally in a hands-on, entrepreneurial role.

You Should not apply if:

  • You are looking for a corporate 9 to 5 job

  • You are political and enjoy gossiping and talking about people behind their backs.

  • You are looking for a stable and slow dead-end job

  • You do not aim to be one of the best in the world at what you do

title: Data Analyst
description:
Our mission

We are living in exciting times where technology and digital transformation improve and disrupt businesses and their supply chains on a daily basis. At Kbrw, we’re disrupting the tech supply chain, and we aim to facilitate this transformation through high-performing software, driving our consistent growth. And guess what? You can help us achieve our vision!

Born in 2009, we are a leading European SaaS company on a mission to build robust, high-quality long-lasting projects. Our high performance cloud-native flagship solutions, such as Order Management System (OMS) and Warehouse Management System (WMS), helps complex businesses implement new omnichannel operations, orchestrate critical business processes, and improve customer promises across all business channels. We meet the highest IT requirements by achieving performance, robustness, configurability, easy integration, while also mitigating IT risks.

Kbrw is self-founded and has grown significantly over the last five years, with a 30% increase in its headcount and its revenue every year. Our solutions are already used by height CAC40 companies and deployed in over 16,000 sales outlets in more than 120 countries, managing a total transaction value exceeding 30 billion euros!

With offices in Paris, Bordeaux, Lille, Clermont-Ferrand, Barcelona and Shanghai our reach is global and we aim to be 200+ employees by 2025!


Let’s talk about our data team

We’re a small and agile team, part of the Product team and working transversally across product, sales and delivery operations. Our mission is to build a sustainable, high-quality data stack that powers both our product and our clients’ decisions.

  • We are responsible for the continuous evolution of our robust and future-proof data stack

  • We support clients daily with reporting, analysis, and data-driven insights

  • We play a strategic role in the company, as data is at the core of our product’s value creation

  • We ensure data strategy, architectural decisions, functional evolution and the maintenance of our data stack are designed according to our product principles (user experience, versioning, standardization)

What will I be doing?

  • Define KPI and design dashboards to support the operational teams
  • Analyze business data to generate insights and help decision-making (Excel/Python/Dash)
  • Develop and optimize data pipelines (ETL) with a strong focus on data structure, modeling, and output relevance
  • Query and manipulate databases (MongoDB, PostgresSQL)

What do I need from you?

This job is made for you if you have a Bac +5 degree from a generalist or technical engineering school or equivalent, and bring the following qualities

  • 3/5+ years of experience in IT Data analyst.

  • Autonomous, proactive, and solution-oriented.

  • Comfortable with MongoDB, SQL, and Python for data processing and analysis.

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into business insights.

  • Experience or knowledge in Supply Chain (SCOR DS), Retail, or Industry is a plus.

  • Interest in both data engineering (pipelines, databases) and data analysis (reporting, KPIs, insights).

  • Experience in a SaaS B2B company is a plus.

The stuff you wanna know

  • An attractive compensation package:
    • A transparent remuneration policy: from software developers to department heads
    • Participation in profits in France via the profit-sharing system
    • Possibility of bonuses based on your results
  • Family-friendly work-life balance: 2 days remote policy
  • Meal allowance with Swile (€9.5 daily)
  • ‍️ Private healthcare provided by AXA (100% covered by Kbrw for you and your family)
  • Access to Leeto perks: theater, opera, sports clubs, concerts, festivals, trade fairs, etc.
  • Work in an international, dynamic, and passionate environment with a company culture focused on learning and development:
    • Software engineers' training: our developers undergo a one-month training in Elixir and React with a complete internal and certified training (Qualiopi)
    • Personal development plan: each employee has an personal development plan established by their manager to integrate quickly and progress within the company
    • Manager training: our managers are trained by our HR team and management experts to help provide the best managerial experience for their teams
    • A structured and mature management process: our management approach is structured through well-defined processes via Lattice, an HR management platform
  • Opportunities to grow fast: responsibilities and promotions are discussed twice a year during two performance reviews
  • ️ Kbrw cares about our teams: we have been labeled a “Great Place to Work” for 2024/2025

Our Recruitement Process

  • First meeting with Hari to get to know each other - 45 min
  • A technical visio interview with Nicolas and Baptiste - 1 hour
  • A last interview on site with François (Head of Product) and Philippe (CEO) - 1 hour

Kbrw is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity is a strength and fosters innovation. We are dedicated to fostering an environment where everyone feels both included and appreciated. Our commitment extends to providing fair consideration to all qualified applicants, irrespective of age, color, family background, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental ability, pregnancy, sexual orientation, social background, or any other characteristic protected by relevant laws.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer – Backend, Data Engineering & Infrastructure
description:
About Teads


Teads is the omnichannel outcomes platform for the open internet, driving full-funnel results for marketers across premium media. With a focus on meaningful business outcomes for branding and performance objectives, the combined company ensures value is driven with every media dollar by leveraging predictive AI technology to connect quality media, beautiful brand creative, and context-driven addressability and measurement. One of the most scaled advertising platforms on the open internet, Teads is directly partnered with more than 10,000 publishers and 20,000 advertisers globally. The company is headquartered in New York, with a global team of nearly 1,800 people in 36 countries.

For more information, visit www.teads.com.

About the opportunity

We are seeking a highly skilled ML Engineer with a strong focus on backend development, data engineering, and infrastructure management. In this role, you will tackle complex challenges at the intersection of backend, DevOps, and data engineering to build and optimize the infrastructure supporting machine learning models and large-scale data workflows.

You will be responsible for designing, developing, and optimizing ML flows, creating robust data pipelines, and addressing infrastructure challenges to ensure the scalability, performance, and efficiency of our systems. Collaboration with data scientists and cross-functional teams will be key to delivering production-ready solutions that drive impactful business outcomes.

What will you do?

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, your mission will be:

  • Design, develop, and optimize backend systems for scalable and efficient data processing, particularly in machine learning workflows.
  • Develop and maintain ML flows to streamline data preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and deployment, ensuring smooth integration between systems.
  • Build and optimize data pipelines using Spark, Airflow, BigQuery, and AWS S3 for handling large-scale data ingestion, transformation, and processing.
  • Manage AWS Batch for large-scale distributed training jobs, optimizing compute resources and cost management for ML workflows.
  • Solve complex infrastructure challenges, focusing on performance and low-latency systems that support ML and data-heavy applications.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, DevOps engineers, and other backend engineers to design end-to-end solutions, integrating ML models with the infrastructure.
  • Manage cloud-based infrastructure (AWS, GCP), focusing on cost optimization, security, and scalability for data and ML systems.
  • Ensure that all backend systems are tested, optimized, and continuously monitored, including writing, running, and automating unit, functional, and load tests.
  • Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and contribute to the ongoing improvement of backend systems, ML workflows, and data engineering tools.
  • Experience with performance engineering, profiling, and optimizing systems for high efficiency and low latency.

What You Will Bring to the Team:

  • Backend development expertise in Python, Java, and Scala, with a strong understanding of software engineering practices, debugging, and performance optimization.
  • Experience building and optimizing ML flows, integrating model training, data preprocessing, and deployment pipelines.
  • Hands-on experience with data engineering tools like Spark, Airflow, BigQuery, and AWS S3, as well as building large-scale data pipelines.
  • Proficiency with AWS Batch for managing large-scale compute resources and distributed ML training.
  • Familiarity with cloud infrastructures (AWS, GCP), and expertise in managing scalable backend services and data pipelines in production.
  • DevOps skills, including experience with CI/CD pipelines, Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes to automate and manage infrastructure.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities to address complex backend and infrastructure issues related to performance, scalability, and efficiency.
  • Excellent communication skills for working cross-functionally, explaining complex concepts clearly to technical and non-technical teams.

Bonus Points for Experience in:

  • Understanding data science principles and machine learning concepts.
  • Familiarity with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.

The Team

  • The AI department currently consists of 50 people who are a mix of data scientists, machine learning and backend engineers
  • The department provides technologies that power outcomes of campaigns with a total yearly turn over of $1.7B
  • Runs large scale prediction and control systems for ad delivery, dealing with millions of live ads, doing more than a billion predictions per second based on large on-line trained models being updated every 5 minutes

Why Join Our Team?

  • Impact: Your work will directly empower hundreds of engineers and significantly impact Teads' ability to innovate and deliver.
  • Challenge: You'll tackle complex, high-scale infrastructure problems at the forefront of cloud-native and AI technologies.
  • Growth: We foster a culture of continuous learning, professional development, and technical excellence.
  • Collaboration: Work alongside talented and passionate engineers in a supportive and collaborative environment.

Life at Teads

At Teads, we don't just offer jobs - we blend creativity, technology, and data to shape the future of media. You'll work with smart humans, meaningful brands, and cool tools, all while helping redefine how advertising works in a world that demands more transparency, better insights, and smarter strategies.

As a Teadster, you'll play a critical role in shaping our future success in the region. Here's why Teads stands out:

  • We've merged two open internet category leaders—Outbrain and Teads—to create the 'new' Teads, a unified omnichannel platform that drives results from branding to performance across all screens, including CTV, mobile, and web.
  • As part of our team, you'll thrive in a collaborative and forward-thinking environment that fosters innovation, creative problem-solving, and continuous learning.
  • Teads is committed to your success, offering all the support, tools, and development opportunities you need to excel in your role.

Our company culture is welcoming, dynamic, diverse, global, and built on top performance.

Teads is an equal employment opportunity employer and committed to diversity and inclusion at all stages of recruitment and employment.

Our team is made up of individuals who are approachable, resourceful, passionate, and proactive. We foster a sense of belonging through our Employee Resource Groups – employee-led groups in which we debate topics and drive change: environmental, women empowerment, charitable initiatives to diversity, equity, and inclusion, you'll be able to share your passions with likeminded people.
company_description: Teads, The Platform That Means Business, is the single access point for advertisers to connect to the world’s best publishers and reach an audience of over 1.9 billion people every month.

title: Data Scientist NLP (H/F)
description:
SIBYLONE, société de conseil spécialisée dans les systèmes d’information de synthèse et de pilotage, aide ses clients à tirer toute la valeur de leur patrimoine de données, levier stratégique majeur de développement et de rentabilité.

Notre ambition : rendre les différents acteurs de l’entreprise autonomes dans l’exploitation des données, libérer les usages Métier, pour qu’ils soient en mesure de relever les défis de performance, de couverture de risque, de financement, de conquête client, de RSE… qui s’imposent à eux.

Spécialistes reconnus, nos consultants s’appuient pour cela sur une connaissance approfondie de l’activité business de nos clients, en lien avec nos trois piliers que sont le Métier, la Data et le Projet.

SIBYLONE emploie environ 250 salariés et réalise un CA de 30m€ dans la prestation de services auprès de grandes entreprises (8 grands comptes représentant 80% du CA).

SIBYLONE est une filiale du Groupe Smart 4 Engineering créé en 2020. Le groupe s’est constitué en procédant à l’acquisition de 12 sociétés en France (dont SIBYLONE), Italie, et en Espagne dans le domaine de l’ingénierie. Le groupe est détenu par Dzeta Conseil, acteur familial de l’investissement.

Avec nos 3,000 ingénieurs / consultants hautement qualifiés, le Groupe offre ses services dans les domaines très porteurs du Digital, de la Data, de l’Intelligence Artificielle, de la Cybersécurité, du Cloud et des Logiciels.

Dans le cadre de notre croissance, nous recherchons Data Scientist NLP pour intervenir au sein d’une équipe IT.

Vos missions

Contexte : Mise en œuvre de plusieurs évolutions du socle technique.


Missions :

  • Cadrage des use-cases identifiés en challengeant leur faisabilité (complexité, données disponibles, cadre légal), et leur intégration dans une vision globale.
  • Gestion des sujets de l’entité afin d’optimiser le cas échéant des moyens envisagés et ce sur toutes les phases du projet : depuis les phases d’idéation / Proof of Value jusqu’à l’industrialisation et monitoring sur le long terme.
  • Proposition de moyens innovants permettant de valoriser les données
  • Définition des modélisations appropriées (Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Data Visualisation, Intelligence Artificielle, NLP …) et s’assurer de la performance des modèles obtenus, et de la valeur générée
  • Apport de son expertise dans les problèmes relatifs au NLP (embedding, BERT, BERT multi task, tranformers, deep learning, rcnn, mécanisme d’attention (machine learning), fonctions d’activation, pattern detection, named entity recognition, …)
  • Conception de la présentation associée, et co-construction avec l’entité et le métier.
  • Documentation des process mise en place en s’assurant de la conformité avec toutes les normes et réglementation en vigueur
  • Communication régulière sur les mises en place menées au sein de l’entité (Réunions, Blog, News interne)

Livrables attendus :
  • Code source
  • Documentation sur la modélisation

Pourquoi pas vous ?

Profil recherché :

  • Formation BAC+5
  • Expérience de minimum 4 ans sur un poste similaire et en environnement grand compte
  • Environnement Technique : NLP – Python – CI/CD – Docker
  • Être force de proposition
  • Savoir organiser et animer des réunions
  • Autonome, rigoureux avec un excellent relationnel

Les
Sibylone !

  • Evoluer au sein d’une société qui exige le meilleur de ses collaborateurs tout en cultivant la cohésion et l’esprit d’équipe !
  • S’engager dans une politique RSE exigeante : labellisation Ecovadis
  • Avoir un Partenariat EcoTree France : 1 recrutement = 1 arbre planté !
  • Un Lab RSE ouvert à tous, pour améliorer la qualité de vie au travail des collaborateurs et nos engagements environnementaux au sein de SIBYLONE
  • Contribuer activement au bien-être de ses collaborateurs : participation aux frais d’abonnements activités ou achat 2 roues
  • Avoir de nombreux moments de convivialités : séminaires, afterworks, conférences et petits déjeuners, sports en groupe via l’application Gymlib
  • Les actions et missions solidaires : notre partenariat avec la start-up spécialisée en RSE Vendredi permet à nos collaborateurs de réaliser des missions auprès d’associations
  • Donner une offre de formation innovante et à la pointe des nouvelles technologies
  • Accord de télétravail en vigueur

Vous vous reconnaissez dans la description du poste ?

title: Data Scientist (H/F)
description:
SIBYLONE, société de conseil spécialisée dans les systèmes d’information de synthèse et de pilotage, aide ses clients à tirer toute la valeur de leur patrimoine de données, levier stratégique majeur de développement et de rentabilité.

Notre ambition : rendre les différents acteurs de l’entreprise autonomes dans l’exploitation des données, libérer les usages Métier, pour qu’ils soient en mesure de relever les défis de performance, de couverture de risque, de financement, de conquête client, de RSE… qui s’imposent à eux.

Spécialistes reconnus, nos consultants s’appuient pour cela sur une connaissance approfondie de l’activité business de nos clients, en lien avec nos trois piliers que sont le Métier, la Data et le Projet.

SIBYLONE emploie environ 250 salariés et réalise un CA de 30m€ dans la prestation de services auprès de grandes entreprises (8 grands comptes représentant 80% du CA).

SIBYLONE est une filiale du Groupe Smart 4 Engineering créé en 2020. Le groupe s’est constitué en procédant à l’acquisition de 12 sociétés en France (dont SIBYLONE), Italie, et en Espagne dans le domaine de l’ingénierie. Le groupe est détenu par Dzeta Conseil, acteur familial de l’investissement.

Avec nos 3,000 ingénieurs / consultants hautement qualifiés, le Groupe offre ses services dans les domaines très porteurs du Digital, de la Data, de l’Intelligence Artificielle, de la Cybersécurité, du Cloud et des Logiciels.

Nous recherchons un Data Scientist passionné par l’IA Générative pour rejoindre une grande institution bancaire et contribuer au développement de solutions innovantes exploitant les dernières avancées en intelligence artificielle.

Vous travaillerez en collaboration avec des experts Data, IA et DevOps au sein d’un environnement Agile afin de concevoir, développer et d’optimiser des modèles avancés de machine learning et deep learning appliqués au secteur financier.

Vos missions

En tant que Data Scientist, vos missions seront les suivantes :
  • Concevoir et développer des modèles d’IA Générative (LLMs, GANs, VAEs, etc.) pour des applications bancaires.
  • Expérimenter et optimiser des architectures de modèles en utilisant des frameworks comme TensorFlow, PyTorch ou Hugging Face.
  • Implémenter et industrialiser des solutions basées sur des pipelines de traitement de données à grande échelle.
  • Collaborer avec les équipes Data Engineering et DevOps pour intégrer les solutions dans un environnement de production sécurisé et conforme aux régulations bancaires.
  • Assurer une veille technologique sur les dernières avancées en IA et proposer des améliorations continues.
  • Participer à des revues de code et à l’optimisation des performances des algorithmes.
Environnement technique & Compétences requises :
  • Langages de programmation : Python (expertise pointue), Shell Unix, Perl, PHP.
  • Outils de versioning : Git, GitHub.
  • Big Data : Hadoop.
  • Notebooks & outils d’expérimentation : Jupyter Hub.
  • Bases de données : PostgreSQL.
  • Environnements & méthodologies : Agile, CI/CD, API Rest, Cloud (AWS/Azure/GCP).
  • Connaissances spécifiques : Réglementations bancaires et conformité des modèles d’IA.

Pourquoi pas vous ?

Profil recherché :
  • Diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieurs ou d’un master en Data Science, Intelligence Artificielle, Informatique ou domaine connexe.
  • Expérience significative en développement et implémentation de modèles d’IA Générative appliqués au secteur bancaire.
  • Solides compétences en programmation avec une maîtrise avancée de Python.
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe et à interagir avec des profils variés (Data Engineers, DevOps, Product Owners).
  • Autonomie, curiosité et appétence pour l’innovation.

Les
Sibylone !

Ce Que Nous Offrons !


– Une culture d’excellence : Nous exigeons le meilleur de nos collaborateurs tout en cultivant la cohésion et l’esprit d’équipe.

– Engagement RSE : nous avons à cœur d’améliorer la qualité de vie de nos collaborateurs au travail et nos engagements environnementaux.

– Bien-être des collaborateurs : Participation aux frais d’abonnements pour des activités sportives ou achat de deux-roues.

– Moments de convivialité : Séminaires, afterworks, conférences, petits déjeuners, soirée annuelle, week-end ski !

– Actions solidaires : Partenariat avec la start-up spécialisée en RSE Vendredi pour permettre à nos collaborateurs de réaliser des missions auprès d’associations.

– Formation continue : Une offre de formation innovante adaptée à nos métiers et expertises.

– Télétravail : Accord de télétravail en vigueur pour une meilleure flexibilité.

Prêt à Relever le Défi ?

Postulez dès maintenant et rejoignez notre aventure !

title: Data Scientist - F/H (Alternance)
description:
Missions principales

Fondé en 1985, Chronopost est le spécialiste français de la livraison express de colis jusqu'à 30 kg, aux entreprises comme aux particuliers, partout dans le monde. Société anonyme simplifiée à 100% de GeoPost (Groupe La Poste), Chronopost s'appuie en France sur un réseau constitué de 100 sites opérationnels dont 12 hubs. Chronopost livre 230 pays et territoires dans le monde et emploie aujourd'hui plus de 5 000 collaborateurs.
Chronopost favorise la diversité et l'inclusion professionnelle. Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

Nous recherchons un(e) alternant(e) passionné(e) par la data science.

Vous contribuerez à des projets d’IA stimulants et apporterez de la valeur à nos activités.

Vous serez encadré par un data scientist au sein de l’équipe.

Vous serez chargé d'implémenter l’automatisation de Proof Of Concepts IA, incluant tout ou partie des étapes de la collecte et la préparation des données au déploiement des modèles mais également la prise en charge de la maintenance évolutive des modèles en service pour les utilisateurs (ex: forecast volume colis, comparaison d’images de colis avec Gen AI)

Dans le cadre de vos missions, vous serez amené à :

  • Explorer et analyser des ensembles de données pour identifier des tendances et des informations exploitables.

  • Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles de machine learning et/ou de deep learning pour résoudre des problématiques métier concrètes.

  • Mettre en oeuvre les IA génératives pour des applications innovantes notamment le profilage d’adresses

  • Documenter et présenter les résultats des travaux.

Profil recherché

De formation supérieure en École d'Ingénieur (Bac+4/5) avec une spécialisation en Data Science, Intelligence Artificielle.

Vous avez une solide compréhension des concepts fondamentaux du machine learning et du deep learning.

Vous maitrisez le langage de programmation Python et des bibliothèques de data science (ex : pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, …) et vous pratiquez l'IA générative.

Vous avez une première expérience en manipulation et analyse de données ainsi qu'une connaissance des bases de données et du SQL.

Vous avez une curiosité intellectuelle, vous êtes autonome et proactif.

La connaissance de Streamlit, Snowflake, Snowpark ML et Linux constitue un atout supplémentaire.

title: Senior Solution Manager, Financial Services & Insurance
description:
Dataiku is The Universal AI Platform™, giving organizations control over their AI talent, processes, and technologies to unleash the creation of analytics, models, and agents. Providing no-, low-, and full-code capabilities, Dataiku meets teams where they are today, allowing them to begin building with AI using their existing skills and knowledge.

Dataiku’s mission is big: enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku’s value proposition is unique on the market as it allows people with very different types of expertise & technical skills to collaborate on a single platform, from no-code/business people to the most advanced Data Scientists, and develop end-to-end Analytics, Predictive and Gen AI projects, from exploration to deployment.

Mission Description

We're looking for a Senior Solutions Manager specialized in Financial Services & Insurance (FSI) to join Dataiku’s Business Solutions team. The Senior Solution Manager owns two essential missions to accelerate Dataiku’s development in the FSI space:

(1) Be a Subject Matter Specialist for FSI, including specific subdomains (e.g., Risk Management, Finance, Pricing, Underwriting). The Senior Solution Manager is a gap bridger between precise industry needs, AI and Dataiku as a product. They directly support clients and prospects as a trusted thoughtpartner and lead the development of high impact supporting assets to accelerate Dataiku’s growth in the FSI market.

(2) Own the identification, scoping, and successful roll out of Dataiku Solutions aligned to industry trends and market research, with the goal of maximizing Dataiku’s value delivery within priority subdomains. Your mission will be undertaken in close partnership with Dataiku’s broader Business Solutions team, including the Solution Director for FSI and the FSI Solution Data Scientists, as well as with Dataiku’s core teams: Sales, Customer, Partnership, Product and R&D.

How you’ll make an impact :

Subject Matter Expert for FSI: Leverage your expertise with the challenges, objectives, types of roles, and tangible data and AI use cases to support the development of Dataiku in the FSI market:

  • Effectively articulate Dataiku’s value proposition for distinct business and functional teams within FSI. Dive deeply into the specific needs of business, functional and operational domains within FSI firms, including in areas you are not currently familiar with, to do a clear mapping of key personas, use cases and Dataiku’s unique value prop.
  • Directly support sales and customer activities targeting FSI firms or priority domains: help field teams understand the specific dynamics of different teams and divisions within these complex organizations, and act as a key expert with FSI prospects, customers, partners and at events.
  • Develop relevant materials to grow Dataiku’s internal knowledge, drive internal sales team community focused activities, and support client engagements.

Solutions Development: As a key member of Dataiku’s Business Solutions team, you will play an instrumental role in the development of Dataiku Solutions: compelling analytic and AI use-cases that showcase how Dataiku solves real-world problems and directly addresses the domain specific needs of FSI teams:

  • Design compelling and competitive Solutions that address real industry team needs, including the necessary inputs, outputs, processes and features.
  • Act as business lead for the creation and launch of these Solutions with responsibility for effective, efficient and impactful results, in close collaboration with the broader Solutions team: Product, R&D, UX, Partnerships, and Data Science.
  • Define success metrics and track KPIs to concretely evaluate the rollout of Solutions and identify opportunities for changes or enhancements.
  • Fuel and qualify the Solutions development pipeline through business experience, client workshops, co-building motions, market research, and partnership discussions.
  • Support the global push for existing and new Solutions by enabling internal teams, leading customer interactions, and building go-to-market material.

What you need to be successful

  • 7-10 years hands-on experience and deep understanding of analytics and transformational projects directly impacting one or more business lines or functions within FSI firms.
  • Experience quickly developing familiarity with the needs and experiences of teams working on topics about which you are not already familiar, via self-driven research and insight.
  • Comfortable describing the continuum of ways in which data, analytics and AI can add value, from automation, pipelines and dashboards to machine learning and Generative AI.
  • Experience successfully engaging diverse audiences on complex and specialized topics, in particular communicating the value and constraints of technological solutions.
  • Experience partnering with varied stakeholders, across different organizational positions (e.g., C-Suite, Front Office, Back Office, Technology), different working styles (e.g., visionaries, practitioners, stewards), and different countries and cultures.
  • Business development mindset, comfortable supporting technology sales cycles.
  • Product management experience, with the capacity to outline precise user journeys, scope use-cases, and support development end-to-end including organizing customer co-builds, testing and reviews.
  • Based in EMEA and able to travel both within that region and to other continents (10% of the time).
  • Fluent in English & French #LI-Hybrid

What are you waiting for!

At Dataiku, you'll be part of a journey to shape the ever-evolving world of AI. We're not just building a product; we're crafting the future of AI. If you're ready to make a significant impact in a company that values innovation, collaboration, and your personal growth, we can't wait to welcome you to Dataiku! And if you’d like to learn even more about working here, you can visit our Dataiku LinkedIn page.

Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please contact us at: reasonable-accommodations@dataiku.com


Protect yourself from fraudulent recruitment activity

Dataiku will never ask you for payment of any type during the interview or hiring process. Other than our video-conference application, Zoom, we will also never ask you to make purchases or download third-party applications during the process. If you experience something out of the ordinary or suspect fraudulent activity, please review our page on identifying and reporting fraudulent activity here.

title: Data Scientist H/F
description:
Data Scientist
Nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist avec une première expérience confirmée pour rejoindre notre équipe à Paris (8e arrondissement) et contribuer à l’optimisation d’une plateforme de recrutement innovante, basée sur des algorithmes de matching et des fonctionnalités d’intelligence artificielle.
Missions principales
Maintenance des algorithmes : Assurer la maintenance des algorithmes de matching existants, basés sur des embeddings de texte, des Large Language Models (LLMs) et la base de données vectorielle Weaviate.Amélioration continue : Renforcer la précision, le temps de réponse et la scalabilité des algorithmes de matching.API LLM : Maintenir et implémenter des API utilisant LangChain pour divers cas d’usage (Django).Fine-tuning de modèles : Contribuer au fine-tuning de LLMs open source, de la collecte et préparation des données à l’évaluation et au suivi des performances en production.Standardisation des données : Développer des solutions pour structurer et normaliser les données textuelles non standardisées issues des CV.Évaluation des performances : Mettre en place des tests, des benchmarks métiers et analyser les métriques pour orienter les itérations produit-technologie.Déploiement : Participer au déploiement des LLMs en production sur le cloud.Veille technologique et R&D : Suivre les dernières avancées en matière de LLMs, recherche vectorielle (ex. : hybrid search, reranking) et outils d’orchestration pour proposer des solutions innovantes et scalables.Collaboration : Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes pour comprendre les enjeux fonctionnels, identifier les leviers d’optimisation et co-construire les roadmaps.Profil recherché
Diplôme de niveau Bac+5 (Master 2 ou école d’ingénieurs) spécialisé(e) en informatique et/ou Data Science.Première expérience professionnelle significative et maîtrise de Python ainsi que d’au moins une des bibliothèques suivantes : NumPy, LangChain, Transformers ou Pydantic.Solides connaissances en NLP, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, et plus particulièrement en LLMs, embeddingset bases de données vectorielles (de préférence Weaviate ou Milvus).Capacité à travailler sur des données textuelles non structurées, notamment des CV.Une expérience en déploiement cloud avec Kubernetes est un atout.Autonomie, curiosité et forte envie d’apprendre.Ce que nous offrons
Contrat : CDI, basé à Paris 8e (présence sur site requise, pas de télétravail).Un environnement stimulant avec des projets à fort impact dans le domaine du recrutement.L’opportunité de travailler sur des technologies de pointe (LLMs, embeddings, cloud).Une équipe à taille humaine offrant un fort potentiel d’évolution et d’apprentissage.Rejoignez-nous pour révolutionner le recrutement grâce à l’IA ! Salaire entre 45 et 55 selon profil

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, CDI

Rémunération : 45 000,00€ à 55 000,00€ par an

Exigences linguistiques flexibles :

  • Français non requis

Lieu du poste : En présentiel

title: STAGE Ingénieur Data & Web
description:
ENTREPRISE

Fort du succès de la solution Komète, une plateforme d’aide à la décision à destination des acteurs de l’emploi et de la formation, KYU Lab recherche un stagiaire Ingénieur Data et Web pour participer à une nouvelle phase de son développement.

KYU Lab est la filiale IT de KYU Associés spécialisée dans le développement de nouveaux services et applications SaaS permettant d’exploiter et analyser de nombreuses sources de données publiques et privées au travers de modules de data visualisation adaptés aux besoins de nos clients.

Créé en 2002, KYU est un cabinet de conseil et d’études de plus de 70 consultants basés à Paris et à Cologne. Pour en savoir plus: www.kyu.fr

MISSIONS

Vous intégrerez une équipe de 8 personnes (2 Développeurs, 1 Product Owner, 2 Data Scientists et 3 Chefs de projet) et participerez directement aux activités suivantes :

▪ Développement de fonctionnalités : Concevoir, développer et optimiser les fonctionnalités de Komète pour améliorer l’expérience utilisateur et répondre aux besoins des clients.

▪ Traitement des données : Intégrer, nettoyer et structurer des données pour garantir leur qualité et leur exploitation dans la solution. Traitement algorithmiques, statistiques, intelligence artificielle.

▪ Conception technique : Contribuer aux choix technologiques et à la maintenance de l’architecture logicielle.

▪ Collaboration en équipe : Participer aux réunions de suivi, proposer des évolutions, et documenter les processus techniques. Méthode SCRUM / AGILE

▪ Veille technologique : Explorer les innovations en datavisualisation et en développement logiciel pour enrichir la solution et plus particulièrement l’intégration de l’IA dans notre solution. Accompagné par 2 référents techniques Seniors, ce stage vous permettra de découvrir / renforcer vos compétences sur la stack technique suivante :

▪ Développement web : Javascript, Typescript, NodeJS, NextJS, ReactJS, HTML, CSS, Vercel

▪ Data Science : SQL, Google Cloud Platform, Google BigQuery, Python, Google Dataform, LLM, Machine Learning

PROFIL

Ingénieur en Informatique ou équivalent, vous justifiez d’un parcours académique et de premières réalisations nous permettant de vous confier (de manière encadré), le développement de notre solution.

Vous avez déjà développé une application web interactive et vous maîtrisez les méthodes de développement Agile. Vous avez déjà travaillé sur des projets de Data Science et avez de l'intérêt pour ces sujets, ainsi que pour le sujet connexe qu'est l'intelligence artificielle.

Une connaissance des environnements techniques précédemment cités est appréciée, notamment sur le Javascript, le SQL et les technologies de Datascience.

Vous souhaitez intégrer un projet d’entreprise dans un environnement type start-up pour participer au développement d’une offre de services web innovants.

6 mois – A partir de septembre 2025

1400€ par mois

title: Internship - 6 months - Data Science F/M
description:
Company Description


Natixis Corporate & Investment Banking is a leading global financial institution that provides advisory, investment banking, financing, corporate banking and capital markets services to corporations, financial institutions, financial sponsors and sovereign and supranational organizations worldwide.

Our teams of experts in close to 30 countries advise clients on their strategic development, helping them to grow and transform their businesses, and maximize their positive impact. Natixis CIB is committed to aligning its financing portfolio with a carbon neutrality path by 2050 while helping its clients reduce the environmental impact of their business.

As part of Groupe BPCE, the second largest banking group in France through the Banque Populaire and Caisse d’Epargne retail networks, Natixis CIB benefits from the Group’s financial strength and solid financial ratings (Standard & Poor's: A+, Moody's: A1, Fitch Ratings: A+, R&I: A+).


Job Description


You are joining the Data & Innovationteam, which is looking for a Data Scientist, for a 6-month internship from July 2025.

We are working on the realization of data science projects (analytical data and machine learning) for the banking professions of the CIB in order to explore business opportunities as much as possible. Our developments are business-related tools, which allow for implementation opportunity studies around use cases based on data science.

A strategic project of the bank consists in implementing a repository of listed instruments and a set of services, which allow to distribute data more easily to users (trading, structuring, risks and finance). You will work on deploying a supervised machine learning model to classify certain instrument features.

In collaboration with your tutor, your main tasks will be:

  • Develop in python this model of machine learning;
  • Collaborate with quants and trading to evaluate the relevance of the results and identify levers for improvement;
  • Present the results to the business teams in a clear and educational manner;
#FinanceTransformative

As a Top Employer, we place our employees at the center of our attention. Internal mobility, career development and training devices allow you to grow and thrive throughout your journey.

You evolve in an inclusive work environment, promoting collaboration with concrete missions and a real impact. We will accompany you throughout your experience with us so that you can learn and develop your skills by working alongside experienced professionals.

You also have the opportunity to commit yourself in favor of society and causes that are close to your heart through our corporate foundation.

You benefit from an internship allowance based on your training and level of studies, also a refund of your transport ticket up to 60%, one day of authorized absence paid for each month worked and access to the company’s restaurant.


Required Skills/Qualifications/Experience


BAC +5 level student, you are preparing a degree (university, business school or engineering school), with a specialization in Data.

You have acquired solid knowledge in Python, particularly in the use of libraries such as NumPy and scikit-learn.

You have skills in statistics and machine learning, and you have already worked on projects involving supervised models (logistic regression, kNN, random forest, etc.).

You are curious to deepen your understanding and mastery of market finance topics.

You are comfortable presenting and communicating information orally, as well as writing and sharing content in writing.

And last but not least, you are perfectly fluent in English.

You will be contacted by one of our recruiters before meeting our business experts.

An ideal moment of exchange to highlight your personality as well as your project.
company_description: At Natixis, we create tailor-made solutions in Asset & Wealth Management and in Corporate and Investment Banking, with over 12,000 employees  in 35 countries.

title: Ekino – STAGE – Data Scientist (F/H/X)
description:
MFG Labs est une société de conseil et réalisation experte en data, qui aide les entreprises à améliorer leurs prises de décision, à automatiser leurs processus et à créer de nouveaux services grâce à la data science, au design et à l’utilisation des dernières technologies.

MFG Labs intervient à toutes les étapes de votre transformation data : de la création d’une feuille de route de projets data, à la découverte d’insights, à la modélisation de problématiques complexes, de la création d’un modèle prédictif à l’implémentation technique d’une solution data sur-mesure

MFG Labs accompagne ses clients de différentes manières :

  • Stratégie
  • Solutions
  • Fondations

MFG Labs déploie une approche holistique pluridisciplinaire, en mêlant des data scientists, des designers, des data engineers et des consultants, afin d’apporter des solutions complètes de bout en bout à des problématiques complexes.


Dans le cadre du développement de l’équipe, nous recherchons un.e Data Scientist en Stage de fin d’études à Pantin (magasins généraux).


Vos missions principales:

Rattaché.e au Data Scientist Lead, vous aurez pour missions principales de:
– Échanger avec le client pour comprendre ses enjeux et ses objectifs métiers
opérationnels.

– Collaborer avec le consultant/chef de projet pour construire la feuille de route du projet et assurer son suivi.

– Réaliser les analyses exploratoires de données pour extraire des renseignements
utiles à la compréhension des problématiques métiers et aux futures modélisations.

– Proposer des modélisations mathématiques en regard des problématiques métiers
exposées.

– Implémenter les modèles mathématiques proposés (Machine Learning, Deep
Learning, Économétrie, Recherche Opérationnelle, Simulation …).

– Mesurer la performance des modèles mathématiques proposés.

– Analyser et échanger sur les résultats des modèles.

– Communiquer les résultats des modèles à tout type d’audience (aussi bien technique
que non technique).

– Collaborer avec les data engineers sur les problématiques d’architecture de
l’information et de déploiement de modèles.

Votre profil:

– Vous êtes en cours de validation d’un M2 en école d’ingénieur avec une spécialisation en data et recherchez un stage de fin d’études.

– Vous connaissez les concepts principaux en statistiques, en Machine Learning, ainsi que Python, l’écosystème de base de data science associé (scikit-learn, numpy, pandas, matplotlib), et SQL.

– La connaissance des outils présents sur un cloud (AWS, GCPP ou Azure) est un plus.
Vous êtes en mesure de développer un modèle “classique” de machine learning avec les best practices de développement (git flow, unit tests, review …).

– Vous avez un intérêt pour la rédaction de la documentation technique (rapports de recherche, CIR, état de l’art …), et restituer ses travaux de modélisation et d’analyse.

– Vous êtes curieux.se, rigoureux.se, et aimez travailler en équipe.

– Vous avez une bonne présentation orale.


Si vous vous reconnaissez dans cette annonce, n’hésitez pas à postuler !

title: Senior Data Scientist, JST Science
description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Japan Store Tech (JST) Science team serves as the core science division of JP Store Tech, with the vision to enable and accelerate the best-in-class CX through state-of-the-art machine learning technologies. This team owns the science vision definition, science roadmap planning, and science solution delivery in key business areas in Japan including Search, Customer Growth and Engagement, Personalization and Delivery.

Key job responsibilities
As a Senior Data Scientist, your responsibilities will be:

  • Lead the data analysis, insight discovery, prototyping and implementation of machine learning models for different business domains
  • Work closely with other scientists and engineers to review and improve your model design proposals.
  • Partner with product managers and other business stakeholders, documenting and explaining your progress in business reviews, and being the technical voice in charge of your product.
  • Be active in the community, participating in science education/growth activities.
  • Keep up to date with scientific development in the field.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

5+ years of data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab, etc.) experience
4+ years of data scientist experience
Experience with statistical models e.g. multinomial logistic regression

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

2+ years of data visualization using AWS QuickSight, Tableau, R Shiny, etc. experience
Experience managing data pipelines
Experience as a leader and mentor on a data science team

Amazon est un employeur engagé pour l'égalité des chances. Nous sommes convaincus qu'une main d'oeuvre diversifée est essentielle à notre réussite. Nous prenons nos décisions de recrutement en fonction de votre expérience et de vos compétences. Nous apprécions votre envie de découvrir, d'inventer, de simplifier et de construire. La protection de votre vie privée et la sécurité de vos données constituent depuis longtemps une priorité absolue pour Amazon. Veuillez consulter notre Politique de Confidentialité pour en savoir plus sur la façon dont nous collectons, utilisons et traitons les données personnelles de nos candidats.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Mener des missions d'expérimentation au sein du "Lab Techno".

AWS Services : Expertise confirmée.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (H/F) - CDI - Paris
description:
Depuis 2014, Wiremind se positionne comme une entreprise technique qui transforme le monde du transport et de l’évènementiel avec une approche 360° combinant à la fois UX, software et IA.

Notre expertise repose principalement sur l’optimisation et la commercialisation de la capacité de nos clients. Nous travaillons sur divers projets tels que la prévision et la tarification de billets, l’optimisation 3D du fret aérien ou le scraping des prix de compétiteurs. Nos applications sont l'outil privilégié de compagnies telles que la SNCF, United Airlines, Qatar Airways ou encore le PSG pour visualiser, analyser et optimiser leur capacité.

Dynamiques et ambitieux, nous nous attachons à conserver notre ADN technique qui est le moteur de notre réussite. L’entreprise, rentable et auto-financée depuis sa création il y a 10 ans, est constituée en majorité d’ingénieurs et d’experts et assure aujourd’hui la croissance de notre business model basé sur des solutions "software-as-a-service".


Tes missions

At Wiremind, the Data Science team is responsible for the development, monitoring and evolution of all ML-powered forecasting and optimization algorithms in use in our Revenue Management systems. Our algorithms are divided in 2 parts:

  • A modelling of the unconstrained demand using ML models (e.g. deep learning, boosted trees) trained on historical data in the form of time-series
  • Constrained optimizations problems solved using linear programming techniques

You will be joining a team shaped to have all profiles necessary to constitute an autonomous department (devops, software and data engineering, data science, AIML, operational research). There, you will leverage state-of-the-art AI/ML methods and ironclad validation processes to deliver robust, interpretable prediction systems.

As a Data Scientist, with support from a Lead Data Scientist, you will take part in the development and improvement of new features and algorithms for our SaaS applications, using a mixture of proven traditional model-based methods as well as recent breakthroughs in Deep Learning for regression problems.

In practice, even though there is no typical day, you can expect to:

  • Develop, maintain, and propose improvements for our training framework via Argo + MLFlow
  • Deploy and monitor of models in production
  • Oversee implementations of new clients from the data analysis phase, modeling, deployment, and hyper-supervision of the first optimization runs in production
  • Develop analytics and AB testing tools to help us continuously improving our models
  • Mentor junior team members through model reviews, technical guidance, and best practices sharing


Technical stack:

  • Backend: Python 3.11+ with SQLAlchemy
  • Orchestration: Argo workflows over an auto-scaled Kubernetes cluster
  • Datastores: Druid and postgresql
  • Common ML libraries/tools: TensorFlow/Keras, LightGBM, XGBooost, Pandas, Dask, Dash, Jupyter notebooks
  • Model versioning and registry tool: Mlflow
  • Gitlab / Kubernetes for CI/CD
  • Prometheus/Grafana and Kibana for operations


Ton profil

  • You have at least 2 or 3 years of experience working in Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or similar fiel
  • You have worked on at least one deep learning framework such as tensorflow or pytorch
  • You have a pragmatic approach to ML where testing and frequent deliveries of small incremental gains supported by validation / alerting processes to avoid regression is preferred to a long tunneled research process
  • You're passionate about addressing business challenges through innovative technological solutions
  • You are committed to maintaining high-quality standards in all aspects of your work
  • Experience modelling time series and/or price elasticity is a plus


Nos avantages

En nous rejoignant, tu intégreras :

  • Une startup autofinancée avec une forte identité technique !
  • De magnifiques bureaux de 700 m² au cœur de Paris (Bd Poissonnière)
  • Une rémunération attractive et indexée sur la performance
  • Une équipe bienveillante et stimulante qui encourage le développement des compétences à travers la prise d'initiative et l'autonomie
  • Un environnement d'apprentissage avec des possibilités d’évolution ‍

Tu bénéficieras également :

  • De formations à la demande
  • D’une politique hybride : 2 jours de télétravail par semaine et la possibilité de travailler ponctuellement depuis l’étranger
  • D’une belle culture d’entreprise (afterworks mensuels, réunions régulières sur la technologie et les produits, séminaires annuels hors site, team-buildings…)
  • D’un budget annuel pour ton équipement informatique
  • D’un partenariat avec le réseau de crèches inter-entreprises People & Baby pour faciliter l’accueil de tes enfants de 0 à 3 ans

Notre processus de recrutement

  • Un screening interview avec Anne-Laure, notre Sénior Talent Manager
  • Un entretien avec Ali, Lead ML Engineer et Hiring Manager
  • Un test technique ou une étude de cas à préparer
  • Un entretien dans nos locaux pour discuter de ton test technique
  • Un culture fit interview avec Charles, notre CTO et Co-fondateur


Wiremind s'engage en faveur de l'égalité des chances, de la diversité et de l'équité. Nous encourageons tous les candidats et candidates ayant l'expérience nécessaire à postuler à nos offres d'emploi.

title: Data Scientist H/F
description:
Qui sommes-nous ?

Growth Lab : n1n1 est une entreprise R&D française spécialisée dans la conception de plateformes d’intelligence artificielle sur mesure, dédiées à l’optimisation et à l’automatisation des processus métier. Nous développons des solutions propriétaires à fort impact, modulaires, scalables et sécurisées, avec une ambition claire : bâtir une IA métier souveraine, industrialisable et utile.

Votre mission

En tant que Data Scientist, vous jouerez un rôle clé dans la R&D et le développement de nos modules IA. Vous interviendrez sur l’ensemble du cycle de vie des projets IA : cadrage, modélisation, entraînement, évaluation, industrialisation et amélioration continue.

Vos responsabilités

  • Analyser les problématiques métier et les cas d’usage IA proposés
  • Concevoir et entraîner des modèles de machine learning (supervisé / non supervisé / NLP / LLM)
  • Participer à la mise en place de pipelines de données robustes et reproductibles
  • Travailler en collaboration avec les développeurs full-stack et les experts cloud pour l’intégration dans des architectures MLOps
  • Expérimenter des approches innovantes sur des jeux de données structurés et non structurés
  • Contribuer à l’amélioration continue de notre stack IA et de nos frameworks propriétaires
  • Participer à des projets de POC ou MVP pour des clients dans des secteurs variés (juridique, santé, industrie…)

Profil recherché

  • Formation supérieure en mathématiques appliquées, statistiques, data science, IA ou équivalent
  • minimum 2 ans d’expérience en data science ou machine learning dans un environnement technique exigeant
  • Maîtrise de Python et des bibliothèques data/ML (pandas, scikit-learn, XGBoost, TensorFlow ou PyTorch)
  • Compétences solides en NLP, embeddings, vectorisation, et fine-tuning de modèles pré-entraînés
  • Bonne culture des LLM, outils open-source (Hugging Face, LangChain, etc.) et des enjeux autour de l’IA générative
  • Aisance à travailler en équipe interdisciplinaire (DevOps, architectes, métiers)
  • Goût pour les environnements agiles, les projets concrets et les challenges techniques

Pourquoi rejoindre GLN1 ?

  • Rejoindre une entreprise visionnaire à la frontière de la Deep Tech et de l’opérationnel
  • Travailler sur des projets IA concrets, avec un réel impact terrain
  • Participer à la construction de solutions propriétaires de nouvelle génération
  • Évoluer dans une équipe experte, bienveillante et passionnée
  • Contribuer à des chantiers R&D stratégiques soutenus par France 2030 et la BPI

Postulez dès maintenant en envoyant votre CV, quelques projets ou contributions (GitHub, publications, etc.) et un court message de motivation.

  • Intéressement et participation
  • Prise en charge du transport quotidien

Horaires :

Rémunération supplémentaire :

  • Prime annuelle
